alert.note: Alert for Jemez Mountains; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Northwest Highlands; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 5:25PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL SANDOVAL COUNTY THROUGH 600 PM MDT... At 524 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of San Ysidro, or 27 miles northwest of Rio Rancho, moving west at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Sandoval County. This includes Highway 550 between Mile Markers 29 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Northwest Highlands; West Central Highlands
